etymologies: late Middle English; earliest use found in Reginald Pecock (c1392–?1459), bishop of Chichester and religious author. From scrivener + -y

definitions: The occupation, position, or craft of a scrivener; the work of a copyist or clerk. Frequently attributive. Now rare (chiefly Irish English in later use).
An establishment employing scriveners; a room or place in which scriveners work.

notes.text: Chiefly with reference to the establishment run by Francis Bacon (1561–1626) and his brother Anthony Bacon (1558–1601) in Twickenham.
